_header: In trifling tales by poets told
_description: Moral lines against fictitious tales — 6 lines

HunEL26C9.Transcription:
In triflieng tales by poets toldwhoe spends their time and beats
                    their braineand leves good bookes þat vertews holddoth spare the
                    strawe and spoile the grainesvtch folke build vpp their howses in the
                    sandand leves godds trewth by which we owght to stand
HunEL26C9.Note:
Added by a hand of the sixteenth century; signed, ‘RN’
                    (Roger Lord North).
